TI: [The influence of sex hormones on the bioelectric activity of the cortex and hypothalamo-reticulo-limbic structures of the brain].
AB: In rabbits and rats, sexual steroid hormones were shown to alter bioelectric activity mainly in the structures of the Nauta septo-hypothalamo-hippocampal circle and the amygdalar circle of the limbic system. The data obtained suggested participation of steroid hormones in the processes of self-regulation of the cerebral reticulo-hypothalamolimbic complex's functions by means of involving into the process of reverberations in the limbic system's circles.
TT: Vliianie polovykh gormonov na bioelektricheskuiu aktivnost' kory i gipotalamo-retikulo-limbicheskikh struktur golovnogo mozga
TA: Fiziol Zh SSSR Im I M Sechenova
JT: Fiziologicheskii zhurnal SSSR imeni I. M. Sechenova
SO: Fiziol Zh SSSR Im I M Sechenova. 1975 Apr;61(4):488-501.
